Detailed Description

Dynamic array.

This array is able to grow dynamically upon request.

The resize involve an allocation of a new array segment, without reallocating the already allocated memory, and then not increasing the heap fragmentation.

This means that the address of the allocated segments never change.

Define Documentation

#define TOMMY_ARRAY_BIT   6

Initial and minimal size of the array expressed as a power of 2.

The initial size is 2^TOMMY_ARRAY_BIT.

Typedef Documentation

unsigned  size 
)

Grow the size up to the specified value.

All the new elements in the array are initialized with the 0 value.

void** tommy_array_ref ( tommy_array *  array,
unsigned  pos 
)

Gets a reference of the element at the specified position.

You must be sure that space for this position is already allocated calling tommy_array_grow().
